Description: The history of philosophy is the history of the philosophical problems, of the philosophical theories and of the philosophical arguments. It is the history of the disputes between philosophers and of the philosophical mistakes. It is always the history of the new endeavours to dissert about unavoidable questions, in the hope of knowing what is the truth and what is the best. The history of western philosophy is the history of the ideas that gave shape to the western civilisation. It is a patrimony that can't be wasted, a treasure that can't be lost.
